doc.after: Technology plays an important role in student life, as Dartmouth has been ranked as one of the most technologically advanced colleges in the world (as in Newsweek's 2004 ranking of "Hottest for the Tech-Savvy"[149] and Yahoo!'s 1998 "Wired Colleges" list[150]). BlitzMail, the campus e-mail network, plays a tremendous role in social life, as students tend to use it for communication in lieu of cellular phones or instant messaging programs.[151][152] Student reliance on BlitzMail (known colloquially as "Blitz," which functions as both noun and verb[152]) is reflected by the presence of about 100 public computer terminals intended specifically for BlitzMail use.[152] Since 1991, Dartmouth students have been required to own a personal computer.[153][154]
